required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combination of Almonertinib and Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in Unresectable Stage III NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Prospective, Open Clinical Study of Combination of Almonertinib and Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in Unresectable Stage III NSCLC With EGFR Mutation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Prospective, open, single arm study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the almonertinib combined with concurrent chemoradiotherapy in unresectable stage III NSCLC with EGFR mutation

primary_outcome.description: The 2-year overall survival rate was defined as the rate of death within 2 years

secondary_outcome.description: From the first treatment to the date of first documentation of disease progression, or death due to any cause
From the first administration to death from any cause

arm_group.description: All patients were treated with Almonertinib 110 mg once a day for 3 months. Patients evaluated as CR, PR and SD were given concurrent chemoradiotherapy. The dose of radiotherapy was 60-66Gy/30-33F, After the end of concurrent chemoradiotherapy, the patients were treated with 110 mg of ametinib once a day until the disease progressed or the side effects were intolerable.

intervention.description: All patients were treated with Almonertinib 110 mg once a day for 3 months. Patients evaluated as CR, PR and SD were given concurrent chemoradiotherapy. The dose of radiotherapy was 60-66Gy/30-33F, After the end of concurrent chemoradiotherapy, the patients were treated with 110 mg of ametinib once a day until the disease progressed or the side effects were intolerable.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age â‰¥18, male or female.
2. Patients must provide written informed consent to participate in the study.
3. Patients must have biopsy proven unresectable stage III NSCLC (AJCC 8th).
4. Patients must has sensitizing EGFR mutation (e.g. exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R).
5. Patients receiving almonertinib for 3 months and achieved stable disease, partial response or completely response.
6. ECOG score 0-1
7. Demonstrate adequate organ function Patients evaluated as Cr, PR and SD were given concurrent chemoradiotherapy 3 months after targeted therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients progress in 3 months after almonertinib treatment
2. Patient can't tolerate radiotherapy or targeted therapy
3. Pregnant or nursing women

facility.name: Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College of Huazhong University of Science and Technology
